column1: Ganj Dundawara is a city and a municipal board in Kasganj District and the Aligarh zone in the state Uttar Pradesh

Ganj Dundawara is located at 27.43°N latitude and 78.56°E longitude. It has an average elevation of 166 m (545 ft). The city is situated in Gangatic plain. The Ganges is the nearest (8 kilometres (5.0 mi)) holy river to the city.

column1: Ganj Dundawara has a humid subtropical climate. The winters are moderate. The summers are hot and dry
column2: with temperatures regularly exceeding 35 °C. The monsoon season runs from the end of June to September. During the monsoon season
column3: almost daily showers are a common phenomenon. From October onward
column4: the weather is pleasant. Proper winter begins in early December.

column1: Ganj Dundawara is situated on the Kanpur-Kasganj-Mathura electrified railway line. Trains are available to various major cities. The main express train which stops at Ganj Dundawara is the Ahmedabad-Gorakghpur Express (19409/19410). The town is connected to the district headquarters
column3: by railway and road. UPSRTC provides various bus services from Ganj Dundwara to Etah (38 km (24 mi))
column6: Aligarh (90 km (56 mi)) and Bareilly (100 km (62 mi)).
